txt.en: '[placeholder], I have decided that before we take further action, we must dispose of the vile corpse of the Witch-king's fell-beast.\n\n'I feel a shudder of revolt every time I look upon it, remembering how my uncle and king died there, and how my sister Éowyn nearly fell, too, battling the Witch-king. The men shun it as well, and whisper that it is ill luck to let your gaze linger on the dead beast. It should be purged.'
'We must dispose of the vile corpse of the Witch-king's fell-beast.'
'I shall fetch Mithrandir to accompany us.'
'I am sure that loremasters of Gondor will learn much.'
You should talk to Éomer, who can be found at Aragorn's pavilion on the after-battle Pelennor.
'I am sure that loremasters of Gondor will learn much from studying the head of that foul creature. I hope only that the risk does not outweigh the reward.'
Éomer, King of Rohan, has decided to investigate the slain fell-beast of the Witch-king.
'Let me know when you are ready and I shall fetch Mithrandir to accompany us. He has mentioned some concern with the corpse and wishes to oversee its disposal.'
You should talk to Éomer, who can be found at Aragorn's pavilion on the after-battle Pelennor.
